Module jtrim.access
Package org.jtrim2.access

Class AccessTokens

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.access.AccessTokens
public final class AccessTokens extends Object
A utility class containing static convenience methods for AccessTokens.

  • Method Details

    • addReleaseAllListener

      public static ListenerRef addReleaseAllListener(Collection<? extends AccessToken<?>> tokens, Runnable listener)
      Registers a listener to be notified when all of the provided tokens were released.

      The listener will be notified even if the specified tokens were already released and will not be notified more than once. The listener must expect to be called from various threads, including the current thread (i.e.: from within this addReleaseAllListener method call).

      Unregistering the listener

      Unlike the general removeXXX idiom in Swing listeners, this listener can be removed using the returned reference.

      The unregistering of the listener is not necessary, the listener will automatically be unregistered once it has been notified.

      Parameters:
      tokens - the collection of access tokens to be checked when they will be released. When all of these tokens are released, the listener will be notified. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This collection is allowed to be empty, in which case the listener will be notified immediately in this method call.
      listener - the Runnable whose run method will be invoked when all the specified access tokens are released. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the reference to the newly registered listener which can be used to remove this newly registered listener, so it will no longer be notified of the release event. Note that this method may return an unregistered listener if all the access tokens were already released prior to this method call. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null or any of the specified tokens in the collection is null

    • addReleaseAnyListener

      public static ListenerRef addReleaseAnyListener(Collection<? extends AccessToken<?>> tokens, Runnable listener)
      Registers a listener to be notified when at least one of the provided tokens has been released. The listener will not be notified multiple times. The listener must expect to be called from various threads, including the current thread (i.e.: from within this addReleaseAllListener method call).

      Unregistering the listener

      Unlike the general removeXXX idiom in Swing listeners, this listener can be removed using the returned reference.

      The unregistering of the listener is not necessary, the listener will automatically be unregistered once it has been notified.

      Parameters:
      tokens - the collection of access tokens to be checked when they will be released. When at least one of these tokens is released, the listener will be notified. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This collection is allowed to be empty, in which case the listener will never be notified.
      listener - the Runnable whose run method will be invoked when all the specified access tokens are released. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the reference to the newly registered listener which can be used to remove this newly registered listener, so it will no longer be notified of the release event. Note that this method may return an unregistered listener. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null or any of the specified tokens in the collection is null

    • createToken

      public static <IDType> AccessToken<IDType> createToken(IDType id)
      Creates a new independent AccessToken.

      The returned token does not conflict with any other AccessTokens and will function as a general purpose AccessToken.

      Type Parameters:
      IDType - the type of ID associated with the returned AccessToken
      Parameters:
      id - the ID associated with the returned AccessToken. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the newly created AccessToken. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • combineTokens

      public static <IDType> AccessToken<IDType> combineTokens(IDType id, AccessToken<?>... tokens)
      Creates a new AccessToken from two underlying AccessTokens which will only execute tasks if both the passed AccessTokens allow tasks to be executed. The returned token effectively represents a token that is associated with the rights of both passed AccessTokens. Releasing the returned token will release both tokens passed in the arguments but the returned token is considered released even if only one of the underlying tokens is released.

      Note that the order of the passed AccessTokens does not matter.

      Note that the resulting token will submit tasks to executors of both specified tokens to detect scheduled tokens. These tasks are not the same as the ones passed to the resulting token.

      Type Parameters:
      IDType - the type of ID of the returned AccessToken
      Parameters:
      id - the access ID of the returned access token. This argument cannot be null.
      tokens - the tokens to be combined. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. Also this array must contain at least a single element.
      Returns:
      the new combined AccessToken. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if there are zero tokens specified in the arguments
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • releaseAndCancelTokens

      public static void releaseAndCancelTokens(AccessToken<?>... tokens)
      Calls releaseAndCancel() on all of the passed AccessTokens.
      Parameters:
      tokens - the AccessTokens to be released. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of the tokens are null. Note that even if this exception is thrown some tokens might have already been released by this method.

    • releaseAndCancelTokens

      public static void releaseAndCancelTokens(Collection<? extends AccessToken<?>> tokens)
      Calls releaseAndCancel() on all of the passed AccessTokens.
      Parameters:
      tokens - the AccessTokens to be released. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of the tokens are null. Note that even if this exception is thrown some tokens might have already been released by this method.

    • unblockResults

      public static void unblockResults(CancellationToken cancelToken, AccessResult<?>... results)
      Releases the conflicting tokens of the specified AccessResults and waits for them to be released. This method first calls releaseAndCancel() on all the conflicting tokens then waits for them to be released.

      This is more efficient than releasing and waiting for the tokens one-by-one because this way tokens may be released concurrently so it takes roughly as much time as the slowest token needs.

      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken to be checked if this call should return (by throwing an OperationCanceledException immediately without waiting for the tokens to be released.
      results - the AccessResults of which the conflicting tokens need to be released. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of the AccessResults are null. Note that even if this exception is thrown some tokens might have already been released by this method.

    • unblockResults

      public static void unblockResults(CancellationToken cancelToken, Collection<? extends AccessResult<?>> results)
      Releases the conflicting tokens of the specified AccessResults and waits for them to be released. This method first calls releaseAndCancel() on all the conflicting tokens then waits for them to be released.

      This is more efficient than releasing and waiting for the tokens one-by-one because this way tokens may be released concurrently so it takes roughly as much time as the slowest token needs.

      Parameters:
      cancelToken - the CancellationToken to be checked if this call should return (by throwing an OperationCanceledException immediately without waiting for the tokens to be released.
      results - the AccessResults of which the conflicting tokens need to be released. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of the AccessResults are null. Note that even if this exception is thrown some tokens might have already been released by this method.
      OperationCanceledException - thrown if the specified CancellationToken signals a cancellation request before the specified tokens were released. The tokens were requested to be released even if this exception is thrown.
